Package it.polimi.ingsw.view

Interface UserInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AInterface, CLInterface, GuiInterface
    public interface UserInterface

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Action chooseAction​(java.util.List<Action> available, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user to choose between a set of actions he can use
      Color chooseAmmo​(java.util.List<Color> available, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user which ammo he wants to use
      Direction chooseDirection​(java.util.List<Direction> possible, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the player to choose a direction
      java.lang.Boolean chooseFrenzy()
      Asks the user about the Frenzy mode for the starting match
      java.lang.Integer chooseMap()
      Asks the user to choose which map he wants to use
      Point choosePosition​(java.util.List<Point> positions, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user to choose a precise position on the map
      Power choosePower​(java.util.List<Power> inHand, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user to choose a power to use
      java.lang.Integer chooseRoom​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> rooms, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user to choose a room
      Player chooseTarget​(java.util.List<Player> targets, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user which enemy he wants to target with an effect between a list of possible enemies
      Weapon chooseWeapon​(java.util.List<Weapon> available, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user to choose between a set of his weapons
      Power discardPower​(java.util.List<Power> powers, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user to discard one power card
      Weapon discardWeapon​(java.util.List<Weapon> inHand, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user to choose which weapon to discard
      void endGame​(java.util.List<Player> winnerList)
      Sends to the client the list of players in winning order and notifies the end of the game
      void generalMessage​(java.lang.String message)
      Prints out a general message to the client interface
      Fighter getFighter​(java.util.List<Fighter> available)
      Asks the user fot the fighter
      java.lang.String getIPAddress()
      Asks the user for the IP address of the server
      java.lang.String getLocalAddress​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> possibleIP)
      Asks the user for the IP address of the local machine
      java.lang.String getNickname()
      Asks the user for the nickname
      java.lang.String getPhrase()
      Asks the user for the effect phrase
      java.lang.Integer getSkullNum()
      Asks the user how many skulls he wants in the play
      Weapon grabWeapon​(java.util.List<Weapon> grabbable, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user to choose which weapon he wants to buy from the SpawnCell
      Point moveEnemy​(Player enemy, java.util.List<Point> destinations, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user where to movePlayer an enemy
      Point movePlayer​(java.util.List<Point> destinations, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user where he wants to movePlayer
      Weapon reload​(java.util.List<Weapon> reloadable, boolean mustChoose)
      Asks the user which unloaded weapons located in his hand he wants to reload
      void updateGame​(MatchView matchView)
      Update the actual gameView to the client
      boolean useRMI()
      Asks the user to choose between TCP and RMI connection

    • Method Detail

      • updateGame

        void updateGame​(MatchView matchView)
        Update the actual gameView to the client
        Parameters:
        matchView - current game view

      • chooseAction

        Action chooseAction​(java.util.List<Action> available,
                    boolean mustChoose)
        Asks the user to choose between a set of actions he can use
        Parameters:
        available - List of available actions
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Chosen action

      • chooseWeapon

        Weapon chooseWeapon​(java.util.List<Weapon> available,
                    boolean mustChoose)
        Asks the user to choose between a set of his weapons
        Parameters:
        available - List of available weapons
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Chosen weapon

      • grabWeapon

        Weapon grabWeapon​(java.util.List<Weapon> grabbable,
                  boolean mustChoose)
        Asks the user to choose which weapon he wants to buy from the SpawnCell
        Parameters:
        grabbable - List of weapons that can be picked up by the player
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Chosen weapon

      • reload

        Weapon reload​(java.util.List<Weapon> reloadable,
              boolean mustChoose)
        Asks the user which unloaded weapons located in his hand he wants to reload
        Parameters:
        reloadable - Weapons that are currently not loaded
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Weapon to be reloaded

      • movePlayer

        Point movePlayer​(java.util.List<Point> destinations,
                 boolean mustChoose)
        Asks the user where he wants to movePlayer
        Parameters:
        destinations - Possible destinations for the user
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Point where the player will be when he's done moving

      • chooseTarget

        Player chooseTarget​(java.util.List<Player> targets,
                    boolean mustChoose)
        Asks the user which enemy he wants to target with an effect between a list of possible enemies
        Parameters:
        targets - List of player that can be targeted
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Chosen target

      • moveEnemy

        Point moveEnemy​(Player enemy,
                java.util.List<Point> destinations,
                boolean mustChoose)
        Asks the user where to movePlayer an enemy
        Parameters:
        enemy - Enemy to be moved by the player
        destinations - Possible destinations for the enemy
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Point where the enemy will be after being moved

      • discardPower

        Power discardPower​(java.util.List<Power> powers,
                   boolean mustChoose)
        Asks the user to discard one power card
        Parameters:
        powers - List of power cards in player's hand
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Card to be discarded

        Returns:
        chosen direction

        Returns:
        True for final Frenzy mode, false elsewhere

        inHand - List of powers in hand
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Chosen power

      • chooseAmmo

        Color chooseAmmo​(java.util.List<Color> available,
                 boolean mustChoose)
        Asks the user which ammo he wants to use
        Parameters:
        available - List of powers on the player's board which can be used
        mustChoose - If false, the user can choose not to choose. In this case the function returns null
        Returns:
        Color of the chosen ammo

      • endGame

        Prints out a general message to the client interface
        Parameters:
        message - Message to be printed

      • useRMI

        boolean useRMI()
        Asks the user to choose between TCP and RMI connection
        Returns:
        true in case of RMI connection, false elsewhere

      • getIPAddress

        java.lang.String getIPAddress()
        Asks the user for the IP address of the server
        Returns:
        Server's IP address

      • getLocalAddress

        java.lang.String getLocalAddress​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> possibleIP)
        Asks the user for the IP address of the local machine
        Parameters:
        possibleIP - List of IP addresses of available network interfaces
        Returns:
        Server's IP address
